intro: Lysichiton, commonly known as death camas, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to western North America. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy white or yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has arrow-shaped leaves that are often bluish-green in color and can grow up to 1 meter in height. Lysichiton is toxic due to the presence of alkaloids, making it potentially dangerous if ingested. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks.
